column4: how do I copy from a removable device to my home folder? (in terminal)
ok. then that command, but with the actual paths. if it automounted, it should be in /media/
cp -r /source /destination  if you want recursive copy. mv /source /dest  to move
it automounted, but it's not in media.
type  mount   and hit enter. if it's mounted, it'll be listed
it's a zune, it's listed, and I can access the files, but I cannot copy them.
what output does mount give you?
not sure. I can see both hard drives, but not my zune.
and I don't know what it would call my zune...
see? in nautilus you mean? type mount  in a terminal, and pastebin the output.   dmesg  as well
you could get vmware and windows...
maybe if you snoop the usb and become a c guru, you could write the world a zune driver?
I've got some friends who could write the driver, I just have to figure out how to crack my way in. there's a way to do it in windows, but I can't implement the same strategy in ubuntu
root won't help. not if there is no driver. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=622332
in theory, if you convinced the zune that what it was connecting to was the zune software, it would grant complete read/write access, this would make it possible to do what I'm saying
